segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to another lesson here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一节课。

segments.en: My name is Marko.
segments.cn: 我叫Marko。

segments.en: And my name is Katherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine。

segments.en: And today, Marko, you and I are talking about movies, right?
segments.cn: 今天，Marko，你和我要谈论电影，对吗？

segments.en: We're talking a little bit about movies, but mostly we're having a big argument.
segments.cn: 我们会谈论一些电影，但主要是在争论。

segments.en: Okay, I kind of like arguments.
segments.cn: 好吧，我有点喜欢争论。

segments.en: Lots of great words and phrases for you to learn here in English.
segments.cn: 有很多很棒的单词和短语供你在英语中学习。

segments.en: But we've got an upper intermediate level lesson with some people who are not getting along very well, so... It's a couple, a guy and a girl, and they're having a fight, as couples do.
segments.cn: 但我们有一节中高级课程，里面有一些相处不太好的人，所以……是一对情侣，一个男孩和一个女孩，他们在吵架，正如情侣们所做的那样。

segments.en: So we're going to be learning a lot of the different language that they are using in this very heated debate.
segments.cn: 所以我们将学习他们在这场激烈辩论中使用的不同语言。

segments.en: So let's listen to this dialogue for the first time, and then we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 让我们第一次听这个对话，然后我们会马上回来。

segments.en: Wow, that terrible movie is finally over.
segments.cn: 哇，那部糟糕的电影终于结束了。

segments.en: Next time, I'm picking the film, because I don't want to end up seeing a chick flick.
segments.cn: 下次我来选电影，因为我不想看浪漫片。

segments.en: Well, you should have picked.
segments.cn: 好吧，你应该选。

segments.en: In the end, you always complain about everything.
segments.cn: 最后，你总是抱怨一切。

segments.en: Not everything, just this film.
segments.cn: 不是所有，只是这部电影。

segments.en: Even the title is ridiculous.
segments.cn: 甚至标题都很荒谬。

segments.en: And it's so long.
segments.cn: 而且太长了。

segments.en: Those are the two and a half most wasted hours of my life.
segments.cn: 那是我生命中最浪费的两个半小时。

segments.en: So much so that I'm thinking about asking them to give me my money back.
segments.cn: 甚至让我考虑要求他们退我钱。

segments.en: I'm thinking of taking you back home.
segments.cn: 我在考虑带你回家。

segments.en: I thought we could have a nice evening, but you're always so negative.
segments.cn: 我以为我们可以度过一个愉快的晚上，但你总是这么消极。

segments.en: I'm only complaining about a movie that I could have rented or bought, and then thrown in the garbage.
segments.cn: 我只是抱怨一部我本可以租或买，然后扔掉的电影。

segments.en: You see?
segments.cn: 你看到了吗？

segments.en: That's what I'm talking about.
segments.cn: 这就是我所说的。

segments.en: I can't stand your sarcastic jokes anymore.
segments.cn: 我再也受不了你的讽刺笑话了。

segments.en: Next time, go with your gay friend who is more in touch with his feelings.
segments.cn: 下次，和你那个更懂感情的同性恋朋友一起去吧。

segments.en: Well, he's more of a man than you are.
segments.cn: 好吧，他比你更像个男人。

segments.en: At least he appreciates love stories.
segments.cn: 至少他欣赏爱情故事。

segments.en: Love stories?
segments.cn: 爱情故事？

segments.en: More like one-night stands.
segments.cn: 更像是一夜情。

segments.en: Don't criticize Mario, or else I'll start on those fat, drunk friends of yours.
segments.cn: 不要批评Mario，否则我就要开始说你那些胖胖的、喝醉的朋友了。

segments.en: They're no saints.
segments.cn: 他们可不是圣人。

segments.en: My friends?
segments.cn: 我的朋友？

segments.en: Fat?
segments.cn: 胖？

segments.en: What about those whales you call friends?
segments.cn: 那些你称之为朋友的鲸鱼呢？

segments.en: You're unbearable.
segments.cn: 你真让人受不了。

segments.en: You can walk home.
segments.cn: 你可以走路回家。

segments.en: I'm leaving.
segments.cn: 我走了。

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: I think the guy was exaggerating a little bit.
segments.cn: 我觉得那个男的有点夸张。

segments.en: What do you think?
segments.cn: 你觉得呢？

segments.en: I think they were both exaggerating.
segments.cn: 我觉得他们俩都在夸张。

segments.en: You know, by the end of an argument, both people are saying things that maybe they don't mean.
segments.cn: 你知道，争论结束时，双方都在说一些他们可能并不真正想说的话。

segments.en: Hmm.
segments.cn: 嗯。

segments.en: I think we'll talk a little bit more about this towards the end of the show, but now why don't we take a look at language takeaway.
segments.cn: 我想我们会在节目结束时多谈谈这个，但现在我们来看看语言要点。

segments.en: Alright, on language takeaway today we have four words.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天的语言要点有四个单词。

segments.en: And the first one that you probably saw in the very first sentence is a chick flick.
segments.cn: 第一个你可能在第一句话中看到的是浪漫片。

segments.en: Chick flick.
segments.cn: 浪漫片。

segments.en: So first of all, the word chick means a woman, it's slang, and it's not very nice.
segments.cn: 首先，chick这个词是指女人，是俚语，不太好。

segments.en: It's not very nice.
segments.cn: 不太好。

segments.en: Well, I mean, between guys you would use it as like, oh, this chick or that chick, but you wouldn't really walk up to a girl and call her a chick, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，我是说，在男孩之间你可以用，比如说，这个女孩或那个女孩，但你不会真的走到一个女孩面前叫她chick，对吧？

segments.en: No, you wouldn't say, hey, chick, what's up?
segments.cn: 不，你不会说，嘿，女孩，怎么样？

segments.en: That's not something you want to say.
segments.cn: 这不是你想说的。

segments.en: So chick is a slang word for a girl or a woman.
segments.cn: 所以chick是指女孩或女人的俚语。

segments.en: And a chick flick is a girl's movie.
segments.cn: 而浪漫片是指女孩的电影。

segments.en: So a flick is a movie, another slang word.
segments.cn: 所以flick是电影，另一个俚语。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So this is the slang phrase for flick.
segments.cn: 所以这是flick的俚语短语。

segments.en: So, hey, Marco, what flicks are showing at the movie theater?
segments.cn: 所以，嘿，Marco，电影院上映了什么电影？

segments.en: Alright, so movies.
segments.cn: 好吧，电影。

segments.en: So a chick flick is usually a romantic movie, a drama, something that's very... Like beaches.
segments.cn: 所以浪漫片通常是浪漫电影，戏剧，某种非常……像《海滩》。

segments.en: Beaches is a chick flick.
segments.cn: 《海滩》是一部浪漫片。

segments.en: I don't know if you've ever seen that.
segments.cn: 我不知道你是否看过。

segments.en: I've never seen it.
segments.cn: 我没看过。

segments.en: Also, He's Just Not That Into You is one of those new chick flicks.
segments.cn: 另外，《他其实不太喜欢你》是那些新的浪漫片之一。

segments.en: Or like How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days.
segments.cn: 或者像《如何在10天内失去一个男人》。

segments.en: Yeah, How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days or The Devil Wears Prada.
segments.cn: 是的，《如何在10天内失去一个男人》或《穿普拉达的女王》。

segments.en: Bride Wars.
segments.cn: 《新娘战争》。

segments.en: Bride Wars.
segments.cn: 《新娘战争》。

segments.en: Wow, lots of chick flicks.
segments.cn: 哇，很多浪漫片。

segments.en: I've actually never seen any one of these, except How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days.
segments.cn: 我实际上从未看过这些，除了《如何在10天内失去一个男人》。

segments.en: I've actually only seen that one.
segments.cn: 我实际上只看过那一部。

segments.en: Alright, so chick flick is a girl's or woman's movie.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以浪漫片是女孩或女人的电影。

segments.en: And next up we have a word, sarcastic.
segments.cn: 接下来我们有一个词，讽刺的。

segments.en: We're talking about sarcastic jokes.
segments.cn: 我们在谈论讽刺的笑话。

segments.en: So sarcastic jokes or somebody being sarcastic.
segments.cn: 所以讽刺的笑话或某人很讽刺。

segments.en: God, Marco, you're always so sarcastic.
segments.cn: 天啊，Marco，你总是这么讽刺。

segments.en: So what would sarcasm sound like?
segments.cn: 那么讽刺听起来像什么？

segments.en: Um, yeah, he's really funny.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，他真的很有趣。

segments.en: Alright, so it's not really what you're saying, it's kind of how you're saying it.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这并不是你说的内容，而是你说的方式。

segments.en: Right, so it's kind of like by saying, he's really funny.
segments.cn: 对，所以就像是通过说，他真的很有趣。

segments.en: You're saying, yeah, he's a funny guy.
segments.cn: 你在说，是的，他是个有趣的人。

segments.en: But if I say, oh, he's really funny.
segments.cn: 但如果我说，哦，他真的很有趣。

segments.en: I'm saying, he's not funny.
segments.cn: 我是在说，他并不好笑。

segments.en: He's being mean or he's a jerk.
segments.cn: 他很刻薄或者是个混蛋。

segments.en: Sarcasm is kind of one of those things that it's a little bit difficult to learn how to do or to actually get it right.
segments.cn: 讽刺有点难学会怎么做或真正理解。

segments.en: Especially in English, right?
segments.cn: 特别是在英语中，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, Marco, great explanation.
segments.cn: 是的，Marco，解释得很好。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: That's the way it goes.
segments.cn: 就是这样。

segments.en: Oh, yeah, you're so funny.
segments.cn: 哦，是的，你真有趣。

segments.en: So, oh, yeah, you're amazing.
segments.cn: 所以，哦，是的，你真了不起。

segments.en: You should go to... you went to sarcasm school.
segments.cn: 你应该去……你去过讽刺学校。

segments.en: Oh, so my parents... You can be really mean, Catherine.
segments.cn: 哦，所以我父母……你真刻薄，Katherine。

segments.en: Sorry, just kidding.
segments.cn: 对不起，开玩笑的。

segments.en: Alright, so apart from being sarcastic, you can criticize someone.
segments.cn: 好吧，除了讽刺，你还可以批评某人。

segments.en: Like you're ever critical.
segments.cn: 就像你从来不批评一样。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Sorry, I'll stop.
segments.cn: 对不起，我会停止。

segments.en: You're really into character right now.
segments.cn: 你现在真的很投入角色。

segments.en: So critical.
segments.cn: 太关键了。

segments.en: To criticize someone is to complain about them or to say that the things that they do are not very good.
segments.cn: 批评某人就是抱怨他们，或者说他们做的事情不好。

segments.en: So you can criticize a person or a movie.
segments.cn: 所以你可以批评一个人或一部电影。

segments.en: Yeah, so this movie wasn't very good.
segments.cn: 是的，这部电影不好。

segments.en: It wasn't funny.
segments.cn: 不好笑。

segments.en: The actors were bad.
segments.cn: 演员很差。

segments.en: It was really long.
segments.cn: 真是太长了。

segments.en: These are criticisms.
segments.cn: 这些都是批评。

segments.en: Criticisms, alright.
segments.cn: 批评，没错。

segments.en: Well, and then moving on, the girl was finally tired of the guy and his complaints and she said he's unbearable.
segments.cn: 然后继续，女孩终于厌倦了那个男孩和他的抱怨，她说他是不可忍受的。

segments.en: Gosh, you're unbearable.
segments.cn: 天哪，你真是不可忍受。

segments.en: So the root of this word is to be able to stand something, to bear it.
segments.cn: 所以这个词的根源是能够忍受某事。

segments.en: And so if you're unbearable, something is unbearable, you just can't stand it.
segments.cn: 如果你不可忍受，某事不可忍受，你就是无法忍受。

segments.en: Alright, so you're tired of it, you can't stand it.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你厌倦了，无法忍受。

segments.en: She thinks he's so unbearable, she makes him get out of the car.
segments.cn: 她觉得他太不可忍受了，让他下车。

segments.en: And she leaves.
segments.cn: 然后她离开了。

segments.en: Yeah, she says you can walk home.
segments.cn: 是的，她说你可以走路回家。

segments.en: Alright, so that's an unbearable person, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是一个不可忍受的人，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, so we took a look at those four main words here in our dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，我们看了对话中的四个主要词汇。

segments.en: Let's move on now to some of the phrases that we found in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们继续看一些在流利表达中找到的短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利表达。

segments.en: This first one's a common one, especially when we talk about women and men and the relationship between women and men.
segments.cn: 第一个是常见的，特别是当我们谈论男女关系时。

segments.en: We say about men that maybe they should be more in touch with their feelings or their feminine side.
segments.cn: 我们说男人可能应该更关注他们的感受或女性一面。

segments.en: Okay, so if you're saying to be more in touch with your feminine side, what exactly are you saying?
segments.cn: 好吧，如果你说要更关注你的女性一面，你到底在说什么？

segments.en: It's a good question.
segments.cn: 这是个好问题。

segments.en: Well, what you're saying is that you want to be able to express your feelings more or you want to be able to understand more about your feminine side or something like this.
segments.cn: 你在说你想更能表达自己的感受，或者想更多地理解自己的女性一面，或者类似的东西。

segments.en: So to be in touch with is more about yourself.
segments.cn: 所以关注自己更多。

segments.en: It's about self-reflection and self-understanding.
segments.cn: 这是关于自我反思和自我理解。

segments.en: So you could say, I'm a very serious person, but I want to make some changes in my life, so I'm trying to be more in touch with my inner child.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，我是一个非常严肃的人，但我想在生活中做一些改变，所以我试着更关注我的内心小孩。

segments.en: Your inner child.
segments.cn: 你的内心小孩。

segments.en: All right, so to be in touch with.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以关注。

segments.en: And it's usually related to feelings, to something intangible.
segments.cn: 通常与感受、无形的东西有关。

segments.en: Or to behavior.
segments.cn: 或者与行为有关。

segments.en: To behavior.
segments.cn: 与行为有关。

segments.en: All right, moving on now, a heated phrase, a one-night stand.
segments.cn: 好吧，接下来是一个热门短语，一夜情。

segments.en: Oh, I'll let you explain this one, Marco.
segments.cn: 哦，我让你来解释这个，Marco。

segments.en: All right, so a one-night stand is a casual and very quick temporal encounter that's usually a sexual encounter.
segments.cn: 好吧，一夜情是一次随意且非常短暂的相遇，通常是性接触。

segments.en: It's romantic, right?
segments.cn: 是浪漫的，对吧？

segments.en: So it can be between two different people, they meet each other one night, they have a relationship for one night only, and then they never see each other again.
segments.cn: 所以它可以发生在两个不同的人之间，他们在一个晚上相遇，只维持一晚的关系，然后再也不见面。

segments.en: So it's casual.
segments.cn: 所以这是随意的。

segments.en: It's casual, very good.
segments.cn: 随意，非常好。

segments.en: So yeah, you see this a lot in shows like Sex and the City.
segments.cn: 是的，你在《欲望都市》等节目中经常看到这种情况。

segments.en: Yeah, they have a lot of one-night stands in that show.
segments.cn: 是的，他们在那个节目中有很多一夜情。

segments.en: All right, so a one-night stand.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以一夜情。

segments.en: And well, related to this, the girl was criticizing his friends, and she said, they're no saints.
segments.cn: 而且，相关的是，女孩在批评他的朋友，她说，他们不是圣人。

segments.en: Okay, so we could say this in many different ways.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们可以用很多不同的方式来说这个。

segments.en: He's no Saint.
segments.cn: 他不是圣人。

segments.en: She's no Saint.
segments.cn: 她不是圣人。

segments.en: Or I'm no Saint.
segments.cn: 或者我不是圣人。

segments.en: You're no Saint.
segments.cn: 你不是圣人。

segments.en: So a Saint is a good person.
segments.cn: 所以圣人是好人。

segments.en: It's a word that we use in religion to say someone who's like Mother Teresa, or someone who's just really good and kind.
segments.cn: 这是我们在宗教中用来形容像特蕾莎修女那样的人，或者那些非常好和善良的人。

segments.en: And doesn't commit any sins.
segments.cn: 并且不犯任何罪。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And so to say, I'm no Saint is to say, well, I do bad things.
segments.cn: 所以说，我不是圣人就是在说，我做坏事。

segments.en: Or as I say bad things, I'm not perfect.
segments.cn: 或者我说坏话，我并不完美。

segments.en: Okay, so he or they, they're no saints.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以他或他们，不是圣人。

segments.en: They do bad stuff too.
segments.cn: 他们也做坏事。

segments.en: Yeah, very good.
segments.cn: 是的，非常好。

segments.en: So that's the way that you would use, he's no Saint, they're no saints.
segments.cn: 所以这就是你使用“他不是圣人，他们不是圣人”的方式。

segments.en: All right, so I think now we should listen to our dialogue for the last time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我想现在我们应该最后一次听我们的对话。

segments.en: And we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 我们马上回来。

segments.en: Wow, that terrible movie is finally over.
segments.cn: 哇，那部糟糕的电影终于结束了。

segments.en: Next time I'm picking the film, because I don't want to end up seeing a chick flick.
segments.cn: 下次我来选电影，因为我不想看一部女性电影。

segments.en: Well, you should have picked.
segments.cn: 好吧，你应该选。

segments.en: In the end, you always complain about everything.
segments.cn: 最后，你总是抱怨一切。

segments.en: Not everything, just this film.
segments.cn: 不是所有的，只是这部电影。

segments.en: Even the title is ridiculous.
segments.cn: 连标题都很荒谬。

segments.en: And it's so long.
segments.cn: 而且太长了。

segments.en: Those are the two and a half most wasted hours of my life.
segments.cn: 那是我生命中最浪费的两个半小时。

segments.en: So much so that I'm thinking about asking them to give me my money back.
segments.cn: 以至于我在考虑要求他们退我钱。

segments.en: I'm thinking of taking you back home.
segments.cn: 我在考虑把你送回家。

segments.en: I thought we could have a nice evening, but you're always so negative.
segments.cn: 我以为我们可以有一个愉快的晚上，但你总是这么消极。

segments.en: I'm only complaining about a movie that I could have rented or bought, and then thrown in the garbage.
segments.cn: 我只是抱怨一部我本可以租或买，然后扔掉的电影。

segments.en: You see?
segments.cn: 你看？

segments.en: That's what I'm talking about.
segments.cn: 这就是我在说的。

segments.en: I can't stand your sarcastic jokes anymore.
segments.cn: 我再也无法忍受你的讽刺笑话了。

segments.en: Next time, go with your gay friend who's more in touch with his feelings.
segments.cn: 下次，和你那个更关注感受的同性恋朋友一起去吧。

segments.en: Well, he's more of a man than you are.
segments.cn: 好吧，他比你更像个男人。

segments.en: At least he appreciates love stories.
segments.cn: 至少他欣赏爱情故事。

segments.en: Love stories?
segments.cn: 爱情故事？

segments.en: More like one-night stands.
segments.cn: 更像是一夜情。

segments.en: Don't criticize Mario, or else I'll start on those fat, drunk friends of yours.
segments.cn: 不要批评Mario，否则我就要开始说你那些胖胖的、喝醉的朋友了。

segments.en: They're no saints.
segments.cn: 他们不是圣人。

segments.en: My friends?
segments.cn: 我的朋友？

segments.en: Fat?
segments.cn: 胖？

segments.en: What about those whales you call friends?
segments.cn: 你说的那些鲸鱼朋友呢？

segments.en: You're unbearable.
segments.cn: 你真是不可忍受。

segments.en: You can walk home.
segments.cn: 你可以走路回家。

segments.en: I'm leaving.
segments.cn: 我走了。

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: All right, so Catherine, is this an argument that you would say is typical among couples?
segments.cn: 好吧，凯瑟琳，你认为这是情侣之间典型的争吵吗？

segments.en: Or maybe people that are probably about to break up, right?
segments.cn: 或者可能是那些即将分手的人，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, not couples that are happy, I would say.
segments.cn: 是的，我会说不是幸福的情侣。

segments.en: But yeah, you definitely have people who are, well, I guess it's kind of the battle of the sexes, right?
segments.cn: 但确实有些人，我想这算是性别之战，对吧？

segments.en: You have people who are different genders, and so they don't always understand each other.
segments.cn: 你有不同性别的人，所以他们并不总是理解彼此。

segments.en: You know, you want to have your girlfriends as a girl, and your girlfriends behave and talk in a certain way together.
segments.cn: 你知道，作为女孩你想和你的女友在一起，而你的女友们在一起时会以某种方式行为和交谈。

segments.en: And guys do the same thing, but with their friends.
segments.cn: 男孩们也是这样，但和他们的朋友。

segments.en: And so sometimes you have these clashes, these interactions that are negative.
segments.cn: 所以有时你会有这些冲突，这些负面的互动。

segments.en: And you know, when people are upset with each other, they say mean things.
segments.cn: 你知道，当人们彼此不满时，他们会说一些刻薄的话。

segments.en: And especially, I think, in this case, they don't really like each other's friends.
segments.cn: 特别是，我认为在这种情况下，他们并不喜欢彼此的朋友。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: That's a kind of a common thing.
segments.cn: 这是一种常见的现象。

segments.en: Like, a guy doesn't like his girlfriend's friends, because maybe they gossip too much or something like that.
segments.cn: 比如，一个男孩不喜欢他女朋友的朋友，因为他们可能八卦太多或其他原因。

segments.en: And the same thing with the girls, right?
segments.cn: 女孩也是一样，对吧？

segments.en: Because a guy's friends maybe drink too much, play too many card games, single... So I think a lot of times these problems also have to do with the fact that, like, when a girl is with her girlfriend, she maybe acts differently.
segments.cn: 因为一个男孩的朋友可能喝得太多，玩太多纸牌游戏，单身……所以我认为很多时候这些问题也与这样的事实有关：当一个女孩和她的女朋友在一起时，她可能表现得不同。

segments.en: Or when a guy's with his guy friends.
segments.cn: 或者当一个男孩和他的男朋友在一起时。

segments.en: And so that's weird sometimes for the relationship, because you see your partner acting differently with other people.
segments.cn: 所以这有时对关系来说很奇怪，因为你看到你的伴侣在其他人面前表现得不同。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Do you like your boyfriend or girlfriend's friends?
segments.cn: 你喜欢你男朋友或女朋友的朋友吗？

segments.en: Do you get in fights about this kind of stuff?
segments.cn: 你会因为这些事情争吵吗？

segments.en: Or you know what?
segments.cn: 或者你知道吗？

segments.en: The in-laws.
segments.cn: 岳父岳母。

segments.en: Ooh, that's a whole other situation.
segments.cn: 哦，那是另一种情况。

segments.en: That's a whole other situation.
segments.cn: 那是另一种情况。

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对如此。

segments.en: All right, so we want to hear from you.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们想听听你的意见。

segments.en: And also, if you have any questions or comments, suggestions, come to EnglishPod.com, and you can leave it on our lessons page.
segments.cn: 如果你有任何问题、评论或建议，请访问 EnglishPod.com，并在我们的课程页面留言。

segments.en: Or you can email us at EnglishPod at PraxisLanguage.com.
segments.cn: 或者你可以发邮件给我们，邮箱是 EnglishPod@PraxisLanguage.com。

segments.en: We hope to see you on the website in the near future.
segments.cn: 我们希望不久后在网站上见到你。

segments.en: Please get in touch with us.
segments.cn: 请与我们联系。

segments.en: That's all for today.
segments.cn: 今天就到这里。

segments.en: So bye-bye.
segments.cn: 再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
